thread.title: NC's spigot for Golden LEAF could turn back on again
thread.title_full: NC's spigot for Golden LEAF could turn back on again

title: NC's spigot for Golden LEAF could turn back on again
text:
After long skepticism, NC Republican lawmakers may give funds again to Golden LEAF again 
By GARY D. ROBERTSON Published: 7/5/15 10:00 am EDT - Updated: 7/5/15 10:04 am EDT 
RALEIGH, North Carolina â€” Republicans at the General Assembly who once soured upon a foundation that used to get half of North Carolina's national tobacco settlement money may be coming around to embrace it, or at least accept it. 
The Senate budget the chamber approved last month would give $20 million annually to the Golden LEAF Foundation after two years in which it received nothing. 
Key GOP lawmakers at the Legislature had been skeptical of the foundation's effectiveness, especially when largely under control of Democratic appointees. 
Sen. Brent Jackson of Sampson County is a top budget-writer. He says Golden LEAF has done a good job helping rural North Carolina for the most part. 
The House didn't provide funds to Golden LEAF. The two chambers will have to work out that budget difference.
